PAD_EnteredBasement.synopsis: The player enters the toymaker's basement which is quite sinister and dark.

AD_RefugeeLeaderAndWife.synopsis: Repeated sequential AD for the refugee family living inside the toymaker's house. This AD will be played in a loop after the refugees will be saved from the thugs and will be allowed to live inside (or, because thugs were dead or threatened - there's just no one to oblige).
AD_RefugeeLeaderAndWife.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, 8; 49; -98Talk to the merchant, proceed through the scene, forcing the toymaker to let the refugees live. Or just attack and kill the thugs. Wait till the refugees return inside the house.

PAD_PickedBasementToy.synopsis: The character comments on picking up an unfinished teddy bear toy in the toymaker's house basement.
PAD_PickedBasementToy.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, Merchant's House basement, 338; 0; -980Pick up a teddy bear toy

CaravanOx.synopsis: The caravan ox who was pulling the merchant's cart before he arrived back at Wyrm's Crossing.
CaravanOx.how_to_trigger: Talk to the ox with SWA.

Merchant.synopsis: General dialogue for the merchant after the Rivington Rats leave and/or if the player makes a choice in the WYR_MerchantsHouse_Merchant_Conflict dialogue that ends it.
Merchant.how_to_trigger: Talk to the merchant outside his house after the main conflict dialogue.

Thug_002.synopsis: Dialogue of a regular thug - member of the Rivington Rats band associated with the Guild. They were hired to protect the merchant's caravan.

Thug_003.synopsis: Dialogue of a regular thug - member of the Rivington Rats band associated with the Guild. They were hired to protect the merchant's caravan.

AD_DoneChasingOut.synopsis: A one-shot AD that is played between Arfur the toymaker and a Rivington Rats leader Zenovia after the thugs chased out refugees from his house.
AD_DoneChasingOut.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, 8; 49; -98Talk to Arfur and proceed through the dialog, eventually picking up the option that you don't care (not "leave") ORor WYR_MerchantsHouse_ThugsChasingOutand wait for the thugs to finish their job.

RefugeeWife.synopsis: Dialogue of the mother of a refugee family living in the merchant's house.

AD_ChildDrawing.synopsis: A narrator AD for a  child's drawing in Arfur's basement.
AD_ChildDrawing.how_to_trigger: go to 359; 3; -990 in Wyrm's crossing. Click on the children's drawing on the wall.

ThugLeader.synopsis: Dialogue of the leader of the Rivington Rats - the band associated with the Guild. They were hired to protect the merchant's caravan.

AD_Merchant_AfterChasedOut.synopsis: Repeated sequential AD for the toymaker Arfur, who plays it in a loop after the refugees has been chased out (with the help of the player or not). He walks around the house and tries to calculate the damage.

Thug_001.synopsis: Dialogue of a regular thug - member of the Rivington Rats band associated with the Guild. They were hired to protect the merchant's caravan.

Merchant_Dead.synopsis: Speak with dead dialog for Arfur the toymaker, who worked for Orin to place explosive toys to the refugee donations.
Merchant_Dead.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, 13; 49; -92kill Arfur, use SwD on him

PAD_FoundEvidence.synopsis: The party comments on finding a blackmail letter from Gortash to Arfur - the toymaker - forcing him to get some stuff out of the Fireworks Shop and put this into the toys to donate for the refugees. It's unclear what it is, but something that is not good.
PAD_FoundEvidence.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, Wyrm's Crossing,Goto 361; 0; -990Unlock and open the chest, read the note there.

Merchant_Conflict.synopsis: The player happens upon a conflict between merchant Arfur Gregorio and the gang he employed (Zenovia Dawg and the Rivington Rats) as he tries to persuade them to get rid of a family of refugees who took up residence in his house while he was away. The player can side with the merchant or the refugees and get paid for the trouble (as well as annoying Zenovia by meddling in Guild affairs).The scene according to the overview doc:Refugee Ben Golewits stands in the doorway of the house, looking pugnacious, while the rest of the Golewits family cluster anxiously behind him. Outside, merchant Arfur Gregorio is bickering with Zenovia Dawg about getting the Rivington Rats to clear the refugees out of his house. Nearby, several refugees watch the scene nervously, including the tiefling, Lakrissa, if she has survived.
Merchant_Conflict.how_to_trigger: Walk up to the group of NPCs by the merchant's house near the start of Wyrm's Crossing.

RefugeeLeader.synopsis: General dialog for the refugee leader - father of the refugee family who stayed in the merchant's house when he was away.
RefugeeLeader.how_to_trigger: Talk to him either outside the merchant's house or at the refugee camp depending on state.

AD_Conflict.synopsis: Repeated AD for the conflict scene - the merchant/toymaker stands with his thugs next to his home, the one a refugee family took while he was away. He wants the refugees to leave.

ThugLeader_Confrontation.synopsis: Zenovia Dawg, leader of the Rivington Rats, approaches the player after the refugee conflict at the merchant's house has been resolved - she doesn't take kindly to anyone interfering in her (or the Guild's) business.
ThugLeader_Confrontation.how_to_trigger: Zenovia approaches you automatically after the main merchant's house refugee conflict dialogue is resolved.BGO_Main_Agoto 14; 50; -93proceed through the Conflict dialog. Do either of these:persuade to chase out the refugees for half-price or for freeintimidate Arfur to let them staydialog with Zenovia should start automatically after that

RefugeeDaughter.synopsis: Dialogue of the daughter of a refugee family living in the merchant's house.

AD_RefugeeLeader_ChasedOut.synopsis: A one-shot AD that refugee Ben plays when thugs hired by toymaker Arfur srtart chasing out him and his family violently.
AD_RefugeeLeader_ChasedOut.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, 8; 49; -98Talk to Arfur and proceed through the dialog, eventually picking up the option that you don't care (not "leave") ORor WYR_MerchantsHouse_ThugsChasingOut

AD_RefugeeLeaderAndWife_0.speaker: Ben Golewits
AD_RefugeeLeaderAndWife_0.text: Thank the gods - I was sure we were about to be evicted.

AD_RefugeeLeaderAndWife_2.speaker: Marpha Golewits
AD_RefugeeLeaderAndWife_2.text: I don't think the children could cope with being homeless again.

AD_RefugeeLeaderAndWife_1.speaker: Ben Golewits
AD_RefugeeLeaderAndWife_1.text: We're lucky there's still decent folk about.

AD_RefugeeLeaderAndWife_6.speaker: Ben Golewits
AD_RefugeeLeaderAndWife_6.text: At least we'll have some peace now.

AD_RefugeeLeaderAndWife_5.speaker: Marpha Golewits
AD_RefugeeLeaderAndWife_5.text: Peace? What peace? Haven't you heard there's an army marching towards the city?

AD_RefugeeLeaderAndWife_3.speaker: Ben Golewits
AD_RefugeeLeaderAndWife_3.text: Better to be within its walls than without, Marpha. At least here we stand a chance.

AD_RefugeeLeaderAndWife_8.speaker: Marpha Golewits
AD_RefugeeLeaderAndWife_8.text: To threaten us, to threaten the children. Cinta was trembling.

AD_RefugeeLeaderAndWife_4.speaker: Ben Golewits
AD_RefugeeLeaderAndWife_4.text: She'll be all right. She's a brave girl. We'll get through this.

AD_RefugeeLeaderAndWife_7.speaker: Marpha Golewits
AD_RefugeeLeaderAndWife_7.text: She's not brave, Ben. She's just learned to stay silent to avoid causing trouble.

PAD_PickedBasementToy_0.speaker: Player
PAD_PickedBasementToy_0.text: I'm sure this toy'll be finished soon if they bear with it.

PAD_PickedBasementToy_1.speaker: Player
PAD_PickedBasementToy_1.text: These bears are like the ones in the barn - let's hope they don't explode.

CaravanOx_0.speaker: Caravan Ox
CaravanOx_0.text: So many roads, dry hay, coarse feed - but all worth it to be back here again. Nothing tastes as sweet as the grass of home.
CaravanOx_0.context: NodeContext: Warm; a genuine recommendation of the grass as if to a friend

CaravanOx_3.speaker: Caravan Ox
CaravanOx_3.text: Do try the grass, should it take your fancy - such sweetness should be shared.

Merchant_0.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_0.text: Who are you? And what do you want?
Merchant_0.context: NodeContext: Confused at the player popping up now; a little worried by it

Merchant_2.speaker: Player
Merchant_2.text: I changed my mind - I think the family should stay here after all.

Merchant_107.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_107.text: But you said you'd get rid of them! And I believed you - more fool me.

Merchant_185.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_185.text: Well... with Zenovia and the others gone, I don't suppose you'll take no for an answer.
Merchant_185.context: NodeContext: Resigned/weary; sees no other option

Merchant_186.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_186.text: All right - they can stay. Are you happy now?

Merchant_104.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_104.text: Now I have to figure out what I'm going to do...
Merchant_104.context: NodeContext: Annoyed as the refugees are still taking up his house

Merchant_62.speaker: Player
Merchant_62.text: I'm sure a man of your means can find room at an inn somewhere.

Merchant_93.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_93.text: A room can wait. After what you've put me through, I need a drink.

Merchant_39.speaker: Player
Merchant_39.text: You're going to jail - I found the explosive toy bears you 'donated'.

Merchant_133.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_133.context: NodeContext: Blindsided by the player knowing his secret; growing concern

Merchant_19.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_19.text: Whatever you think you know, I'm sure some gold would help you to forget.

Merchant_109.speaker: Player
Merchant_109.text: I'm here to see you are brought to justice.

Merchant_95.speaker: Player
Merchant_95.text: Keep your gold - I want answers.

Merchant_117.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_117.text: I'm just a simple toymaker - an artisan! I don't know anything!
Merchant_117.context: NodeContext: Keen to protest his (false) innocence

Merchant_131.speaker: Player
Merchant_131.text: If I were after gold, I would have gutted you and taken it.

Merchant_55.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_55.text: Please don't! What do you want from me? It's not my fault - I was forced to do this. Framed, even!
Merchant_55.context: NodeContext: Panicked/scared of the player and their threats; keen to protest his (false) innocence

Merchant_124.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_124.text: They would've killed me if I refused to rig the toys - and they're definitely going to kill me now!

Merchant_130.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_130.text: I can't tell you. I won't tell you.

Merchant_23.speaker: Player
Merchant_23.text: Tell me who 'they' are or you'll be dead before they even get to you.

Merchant_88.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_88.text: All right, all right - just don't hurt me!
Merchant_88.context: NodeContext: Scared of the player and trying to placate them

Merchant_52.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_52.text: The teddy bears were an experiment - my greatest invention. A clever little device in their chest allows them to speak.
Merchant_52.context: NodeContext: Anxious but also frustrated; he's definitely quite proud of his explosive teddy bears

Merchant_58.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_58.text: But there's more. Smokepowder, inside the device. I collect packages from Felogyr's Fireworks in the Lower City, and stuff the bears with it.
Merchant_58.context: NodeContext: Fearful - clearly doesn't like recounting this

Merchant_98.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_98.text: Not because I want to - because I have to. Otherwise they'll kill me.
Merchant_98.context: NodeContext: Matter of fact (but a little too excited about seeing them in action before catching himself)

Merchant_142.speaker: Player
Merchant_142.text: I've been to Felogyr's. So you're in cahoots with Gortash.

Merchant_141.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_141.text: Would you keep it down? Or do you want to get us both killed?

Merchant_127.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_127.text: I'm no more 'in cahoots' with Gortash than you are. Which is to say I'm just as much under his thumb as anyone else in this city.

Merchant_83.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_83.text: If you've been there, you know more than I do. Now will you please let me go?

Merchant_35.speaker: Player
Merchant_35.text: You still haven't told me who 'they' are.

Merchant_73.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_73.text: I don't know who's in charge - but it starts at the fireworks shop. That's where the packages come from.

Merchant_79.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_79.text: Go there - tell them Uncle Felogyr sent you, and they'll show you the smokepowder. Lots of it.

Merchant_161.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_161.text: There, I told you what you wanted to know. Now will you let me go?
Merchant_161.context: NodeContext: Anxious again; really wants to get out of here

Merchant_169.speaker: Narrator
Merchant_169.text: *His plea comes with an offering - a pass, granting you access to the Lower City.*
Merchant_169.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arfur hands player something off-screen

Merchant_94.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_94.text: Oh, I will! Thank you! Thank you so much!
Merchant_94.context: NodeContext: So ridiculously grateful at having been allowed to live

Merchant_92.speaker: Player
Merchant_92.text: Thanks, but I'll need all your gold too.

Merchant_32.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_32.text: Here, take it - all of it, I don't care! You'll never see me again, I promise!
Merchant_32.context: NodeContext: Scared/anxious to offload his gold in exchange for freedom/life

Merchant_46.speaker: Player
Merchant_46.text: What's this, bribery? The only place you're going is prison.

Merchant_61.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_61.text: You can't be serious - they'll find me. A cell won't keep me safe! They run this city.

Merchant_49.speaker: Player
Merchant_49.text: I could just kill you, but I'm giving you a chance. I suggest you take it.

Merchant_7.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_7.text: All right, all right, I'll go! But if I'm found hanging in my cell, it'll be on your conscience.
Merchant_7.context: NodeContext: Convinced he's going to meet a grizzly end

Merchant_149.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_149.text: No! I'll be trapped like a rat.

Merchant_140.speaker: Player
Merchant_140.text: At least in a prison there'll be walls to break through before anyone can get to you.

Merchant_9.speaker: Player
Merchant_9.text: Gortash doesn't run the city anymore. I dealt with him - he's no threat to you.

Merchant_81.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_81.text: It doesn't stop with Gortash - his people are everywhere, choking the life out of the city. If I stay here, they'll kill me.

Merchant_172.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_172.text: I've told you everything - and, in the end, no one was hurt. Please, just let me go!

Merchant_145.speaker: Player
Merchant_145.text: Sorry, but you had your chance. Now you die.

Merchant_132.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_132.text: It won't end with him - his people are everywhere. But I'll go quietly. Maybe I have a chance.
Merchant_132.context: NodeContext: Resigned (but still a little scared)

Merchant_28.speaker: Player
Merchant_28.text: All right, just run and never come back.

Merchant_171.speaker: Player
Merchant_171.text: Appreciate it. But now I know all that, I don't think I can let you go - sorry.

Merchant_106.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_106.context: NodeContext: Panicked; he's about to be attacked by the player

Merchant_60.speaker: Player
Merchant_60.text: So you'd rather kill children than risk your own skin?

Merchant_114.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_114.text: It sounds terrible when you put it like that. But maybe you can put a stop to this whole operation.

Merchant_136.speaker: Player
Merchant_136.text: I'm strongly considering killing you myself.

Merchant_43.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_43.text: Please don't - I'm not the villain here! You could put a stop to the whole operation.

Merchant_67.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_67.text: You don't know what they're capable of. I'd rather die by your hand than let them get hold of me.
Merchant_67.context: NodeContext: Scared; mouth running away with him

Merchant_146.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_146.text: Uh... not that I want to die by your hand, of course. I'll leave - risk the roads - say goodbye to the city forever.
Merchant_146.context: NodeContext: Suddenly realising what he's said; backpedalling and trying to convince the player not to harm him

Merchant_25.speaker: Player
Merchant_25.text: Then I have no use for you. Die.

Merchant_37.speaker: Player
Merchant_37.text: Sounds like you're in over your head. All right - get going.

Merchant_68.speaker: Player
Merchant_68.text: Fine - just give me the gold and I'll let you go.

Merchant_97.speaker: Player
Merchant_97.text: Give me the gold and we'll call it quits.

Merchant_3.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_3.text: This is my house, not a home for waifs and strays!

Merchant_147.speaker: Player
Merchant_147.text: I want the family to stay. You have room for them, surely?

Merchant_18.speaker: Player
Merchant_18.text: I gave you a chance to let them stay. Since you didn't, I'll make you.

Merchant_20.speaker: Player
Merchant_20.text: I'll deal with your squatters - just make sure you have your purse ready.

Merchant_44.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_44.text: Purse? You said you'd get rid of them free of charge!

Merchant_14.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_14.text: Ugh... but if that's what it takes to get them out of my house, fine. Get on with it.
Merchant_14.context: NodeContext: Bitter resignation (emphasis on "fine" because it's really not to him)

Merchant_122.speaker: Player
Merchant_122.text: Sorry for the interruption. I have a tendency to pounce on people I don't like.

Merchant_112.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_112.text: If the Guild come asking, I'll be making it very clear that you took it upon yourself to kill their thugs. I had nothing to do with it.
Merchant_112.context: NodeContext: Scared (worried the player might turn on him as they just killed the thugs he hired)

Merchant_135.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_135.text: All's well that ends well, eh? I'm sure the Guild will be in touch with any concerns.
Merchant_135.context: NodeContext: Scared (worried the player might turn on him as they just killed the thugs he hired)

Merchant_75.speaker: Player
Merchant_75.text: The squatters are gone - the house is all yours.

Merchant_159.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_159.context: NodeContext: Jubilant that he has his house back

Merchant_16.speaker: Player
Merchant_16.text: I found some rather sinister things in your basement.

Merchant_91.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_91.text: Sinister? Nonsense. Those are experimental toys - guaranteed to bring a smile to the face of even the unhappiest child.

Merchant_5.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_5.text: They're extremely precious, and you shouldn't be poking around in my workshop and tampering with them!

Merchant_137.speaker: Player
Merchant_137.text: I'll get to the bottom of this one way or another.

Merchant_74.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_74.text: Really - there's no 'this' and nothing to get to the bottom of!
Merchant_74.context: NodeContext: Exasperated (and emphasis on "really"; rhetorical expression of annoyance as opposed to a question/assertion)

Merchant_30.speaker: Player
Merchant_30.text: Whatever you're up to, it's definitely not good. I'm taking you down.

Merchant_113.speaker: Player
Merchant_113.text: Yes you locked the basement, but it didn't help. Whatever you're up to, it ends now. I'm taking you down.

Merchant_56.speaker: Player
Merchant_56.text: Probe his mind for the truth.

Merchant_47.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_47.text: Keep it together, Arfur. There's no evidence that links this back to you, and you definitely locked the basement before you left.
Merchant_47.context: NodeContext: Trying to calm himself in his internal monologue

Merchant_162.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_162.text: Trying to use magic on me, are you? This conversation is over if you can't take a professional craftsman at his word.

Merchant_165.speaker: Player
Merchant_165.text: I found the explosive toy bears you 'donated' to the refugees.

Merchant_10.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_10.text: Not now - I'm trying to think.

Merchant_29.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_29.text: Look, I really don't have time to chat - I'm sure you can find someone less busy to listen to you somewhere.
Merchant_29.context: NodeContext: Dismissive/distracted; has things to be getting on with

Merchant_72.speaker: Player
Merchant_72.text: I've found the toys you donated - care to explain before everything blows up in your face?

Merchant_77.speaker: Player
Merchant_77.text: So what are your plans now?

Merchant_108.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_108.text: Thank you so much for your interest but it's really none of your concern, is it, hm? Excuse me.

Merchant_33.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_33.text: All right - you won, you won! What more do you want from me?
Merchant_33.context: NodeContext: Panicked; worried the player is going to attack him

Merchant_45.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_45.text: All's well that ends well, eh? I'm sure the Guild will be in touch with any concerns.
Merchant_45.context: NodeContext: Scared (worried the player might turn on him as they just killed the thugs he hired)

Merchant_53.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_53.text: Nine Hells - you followed me all the way here? What could you possibly want with me now?

Merchant_64.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_64.text: The Rivington Rats don't waste any time, do they? I can see why they were so highly recommended...
Merchant_64.context: NodeContext: Morbidly in awe at the Rivington Rat's brutal efficiency

Merchant_85.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_85.text: Anyway, I have a lot to do now those squatters are out of my hair. Goodbye.
Merchant_85.context: NodeContext: Distracted; the player is getting in his way now

Merchant_76.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_76.text: Bloody Zenovia and her bloody Rats - truly no honour among their kind. And you - what do you want?

Merchant_80.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_80.text: A shame they had to die - but they brought it on themselves. And I'm the one who has to clean up the mess.

Merchant_96.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_96.text: I haven't got anything else to say to you. Leave me alone - do you think you can manage that?

Merchant_115.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_115.text: Don't deny it - I know it was you! You stole my gold! Unless it was one of those filthy squatting vermin...

Merchant_38.speaker: Player
Merchant_38.text: Well, if you talk to me like that, I'm definitely not going to help you.

Merchant_170.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_170.text: Look, I'm sorry, all right? I just really need them out of my house as soon as possible. Please.
Merchant_170.context: NodeContext: Trying to catch himself/be civil despite his annoyance

Merchant_24.speaker: Player
Merchant_24.text: You ought to watch those chancers you hired - I saw one of them a little too close to your pocket just now.

Merchant_177.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_177.text: It was the little one, wasn't it? Tch, knew I couldn't trust him.

Merchant_63.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_63.text: And what is it that you want?

Merchant_184.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_184.text: You're only compounding your guilt! I have friends in high places - you'll pay dearly for this.

Merchant_138.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_138.text: Finally, those awful squatters are gone! I can feel everything unclenching already.
Merchant_138.context: NodeContext: Relieved that the squatters have been ejected from his house

Merchant_26.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_26.text: I must admit I'm not quite sure why you decided to change your mind, but all's well that ends well!
Merchant_26.context: NodeContext: Confused but pleased by this turn of events

Merchant_84.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_84.text: Here's your payment as we agreed.

Merchant_102.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_102.text: I've got so much to do now - I'd really better get on with it. Excuse me, would you?
Merchant_102.context: NodeContext: Distracted; the player is getting in his way now

Merchant_144.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_144.text: You again. Did you need something?
Merchant_144.context: NodeContext: Mildly annoyed by the player's presence but willing to humour them

Merchant_152.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_152.text: Haven't you got anything better to do with your time than harass innocent craftspeople?

Merchant_156.speaker: Player
Merchant_156.text: How about putting you in the ground?

Merchant_176.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_176.text: If the Guild come asking, I'll be making it very clear that you took it upon yourself to kill their thugs. I had nothing to do with it.
Merchant_176.context: NodeContext: Scared (worried the player might turn on him as they just killed the thugs he hired)

Merchant_1.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_1.text: So you should probably get away from the scene of the crime.

Thug_002_0.speaker: Gleeful Clong
Thug_002_0.context: NodeContext: Clearly does not want to engage in any further conversation

Thug_002_1.speaker: Gleeful Clong
Thug_002_1.text: I'm not paid to talk. If you want something, speak to Zenovia.

Thug_003_0.speaker: Scarpers
Thug_003_0.text: This ain't your property, so buzz off.

Thug_003_1.speaker: Scarpers
Thug_003_1.text: Clear off - there's nothin' in these caravans for you.

AD_DoneChasingOut_0.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
AD_DoneChasingOut_0.text: Job done. Whatever's left is yours to sort out.

RefugeeWife_0.speaker: Marpha Golewits
RefugeeWife_0.text: Does he think we've gotten this far only to give up without a fight?

RefugeeWife_1.speaker: Marpha Golewits
RefugeeWife_1.text: Good thing you sorted that out - I was this close to chucking a knife right between that trollop's eyes.
RefugeeWife_1.context: NodeContext: Pleased - but clearly more than willing to act to protect her family if needs be

RefugeeWife_2.speaker: Marpha Golewits
RefugeeWife_2.text: Heartless scum. I'm a reasonable woman - we could easily work something out in a house this big.
RefugeeWife_2.context: NodeContext: Bitter/quiet anger; ready to protect her family

RefugeeWife_3.speaker: Marpha Golewits
RefugeeWife_3.text: I think I'll still keep something sharp by the door - just in case.

AD_ChildDrawing_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_ChildDrawing_0.text: *A child's drawing, in a basement full of toys and traps.*

ThugLeader_0.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_0.text: Try not to get under my feet, hm?
ThugLeader_0.context: NodeContext: Dismissive; every so slightly annoyed

ThugLeader_1.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_1.text: I'd just turn around and walk away if I were you.
ThugLeader_1.context: NodeContext: Mildly amused - with an uncurrent of threatening

ThugLeader_2.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_2.text: Don't worry, sweetheart - we'll be done here soon.

ThugLeader_3.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_3.text: I've got my eye on you, too, sweetie.
ThugLeader_3.context: NodeContext: Mildly amused - with an uncurrent of threatening

AD_Merchant_AfterChasedOut_0.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
AD_Merchant_AfterChasedOut_0.text: Bloody squatters... I should put bear traps under the windows next time.

AD_Merchant_AfterChasedOut_1.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
AD_Merchant_AfterChasedOut_1.text: Where is my candelabra? Did they take my grandmother's candelabra?!

AD_Merchant_AfterChasedOut_2.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
AD_Merchant_AfterChasedOut_2.text: Can they have found my - no. No, surely not. It's too well hidden.
AD_Merchant_AfterChasedOut_2.context: InternalNodeContext: Plays only near the door leading to the workshop with the secret basement.

AD_Merchant_AfterChasedOut_3.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
AD_Merchant_AfterChasedOut_3.text: I go away for a few days, and the place is ruined.

AD_Merchant_AfterChasedOut_4.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
AD_Merchant_AfterChasedOut_4.text: If they had any idea how much a cleaner costs these days...

Thug_001_0.speaker: Dimples Backster
Thug_001_0.text: And still you're staring at me.
Thug_001_0.context: NodeContext: Still bored but now a little exasperated

Thug_001_1.speaker: Dimples Backster
Thug_001_1.text: Didn't whatever birthed you tell you not to stare?
Thug_001_1.context: NodeContext: Somewhat threatening but mostly bored

Merchant_Dead_28.speaker: Narrator
Merchant_Dead_28.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Merchant_Dead_16.speaker: Player
Merchant_Dead_16.text: Why did you hate those refugees so much?

Merchant_Dead_0.speaker: Player
Merchant_Dead_0.text: What was your connection to the Guild?

Merchant_Dead_21.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Dead_21.text: None... just... hired... their local thugs...

Merchant_Dead_3.speaker: Player
Merchant_Dead_3.text: You donated explosive toys to the refugees - why?

Merchant_Dead_15.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Dead_15.text: I'm just... an artisan... they... made me... do it...

Merchant_Dead_6.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Dead_6.text: Banites... said to... put explosives... in the toys... or else...

Merchant_Dead_1.speaker: Player
Merchant_Dead_1.text: Why did they want you to put explosives in the toys?

Merchant_Dead_19.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Dead_19.text: To prove... Steel Watchers... are needed...

Merchant_Dead_9.speaker: Player
Merchant_Dead_9.text: Where were you getting these explosives from?

Merchant_Dead_25.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Dead_25.text: Fireworks shop... Lower City... password is... 'I'm here to visit... Uncle Felogyr...'

Merchant_Dead_32.speaker: Narrator
Merchant_Dead_32.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

Merchant_Dead_34.speaker: Narrator
Merchant_Dead_34.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

PAD_FoundEvidence_3.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundEvidence_3.text: This must be where he was making them - there's no shortage of evidence.
PAD_FoundEvidence_3.context: InternalNodeContext: (copy of the N3 node) | The toys we found in the barn!.. This is where he has been making them. |

PAD_FoundEvidence_2.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundEvidence_2.text: Seems the owner of this place is responsible for those explosive stuffed bears in the barn.
PAD_FoundEvidence_2.context: InternalNodeContext: "The owner of this house... the toymaker... He was the one trapping the toys meant for the refugees!"

PAD_FoundEvidence_4.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundEvidence_4.text: This must be where he was making them - there's no shortage of evidence.
PAD_FoundEvidence_4.context: InternalNodeContext: | The toys we found in the barn!.. This is where he has been making them. |

PAD_FoundEvidence_5.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundEvidence_5.text: Looks as though the homeowner's up to no good - I only hope no one gets hurt.
PAD_FoundEvidence_5.context: InternalNodeContext: "Owner of this house is messing with something dangerous. These toys should be found and checked." We don't know the toys has explosives in them yet. There's no explosives in the basement as well.

PAD_FoundEvidence_6.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundEvidence_6.text: It looks like our merchant friend's the one who's been putting explosives in teddy bears.
PAD_FoundEvidence_6.context: InternalNodeContext: "Oh no, our friend Arfur is even worse than we thought. He was the one trapping the toys meant for the refugees!". We already found the trapped toys in the Big Barn. Now we learn he was the one making and donating them.

PAD_FoundEvidence_7.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundEvidence_7.text: Might be worth checking Arfur's donations - looks like his generosity's compromised.
PAD_FoundEvidence_7.context: InternalNodeContext: "Looks like our friend Arfur is messing with something dangerous. We should check the donations he's made." We don't know the toys has explosives in them yet. There's no explosives in the basement as well.

Merchant_Conflict_19.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_19.text: What do you want? I have filthy squatters decreasing the value of my property as we speak!
Merchant_Conflict_19.context: NodeContext: Frustrated; annoyed at the player's interruption

Merchant_Conflict_196.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_196.text: This house looks huge - are you sure you don't have any spare rooms?

Merchant_Conflict_46.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_46.text: I could help you get rid of them if you like.

Merchant_Conflict_80.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_80.text: Let them stay or I'll decrease the value of your property by mounting your head above the door.

Merchant_Conflict_45.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_45.text: Want to make yourself useful? Do something about these vermin running amok in my ancestral home!

Merchant_Conflict_235.speaker: Ben Golewits
Merchant_Conflict_235.text: The place was empty! Keep those thugs away from my family!
Merchant_Conflict_235.context: NodeContext: Angry; defensive of his family

Merchant_Conflict_183.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_183.text: Zenovia, get these squatters out of my house now.
Merchant_Conflict_183.context: InternalNodeContext: To ZenoviaNodeContext: Indignant at the situation and frustrated at the lack of action from Zenovia and company

Merchant_Conflict_9.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
Merchant_Conflict_9.text: Arfur, sweetheart - you paid me and my boys to be caravan guards, not cattle wranglers.
Merchant_Conflict_9.context: NodeContext: Cocky and a little patronising; she has no fear of this man and knows she's in the right

Merchant_Conflict_155.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
Merchant_Conflict_155.text: If you want us to get our hands dirty, it'd be our pleasure - but that'll be extra.
Merchant_Conflict_155.context: NodeContext: Sweetly matter of fact - but suddenly hard on "but that'll be extra"

Merchant_Conflict_78.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_78.text: Calm down and tell me what's going on.

Merchant_Conflict_216.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_216.text: I just want to remove these unlawful interlopers from my property!

Merchant_Conflict_179.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_179.text: I've been in your basement - I know what you've been up to.

Merchant_Conflict_107.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_107.text: I have absolutely no idea what you're talking about. But that does rather sound like a threat...
Merchant_Conflict_107.context: NodeContext: Incredulous (but definitely lying/does know what the player is talking about)

Merchant_Conflict_66.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_66.text: This is a pretty big house - are you sure you don't have a single spare room?

Merchant_Conflict_143.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_143.text: Pft, they're like kobolds - you let one in and soon the place will be crawling with them!

Merchant_Conflict_214.speaker: Karlach
Merchant_Conflict_214.text: Ye gods, this guy is begging to get smacked.
Merchant_Conflict_214.context: NodeContext: Shitty landlord with a highly punchable demeanour. But Karlach is saying this a bit to herself/ the team, trying not to make the situation worse.

Merchant_Conflict_83.speaker: Narrator
Merchant_Conflict_83.text: *This man's indignant demeanour barely masks a seething anxiety. There's more to this situation than he's letting on.*

Merchant_Conflict_76.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_76.text: I'm a very magnanimous individual, but this is my home. Either they leave, or I'll make them.

Merchant_Conflict_1.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_1.text: You seem to be a little on edge - are you all right?

Merchant_Conflict_106.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_106.text: Well, wouldn't you be on edge if your beautiful home had been defiled by such brazen interlopers?
Merchant_Conflict_106.context: NodeContext: Definitely showing his nervousness; worried the player might know his secret

Merchant_Conflict_36.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_36.text: How about you live and let live and I let you live in return?

Merchant_Conflict_103.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_103.text: In that case, perhaps I can help you out.

Merchant_Conflict_145.speaker: Ben Golewits
Merchant_Conflict_145.context: NodeContext: Wary; doesn't want someone else involved

Merchant_Conflict_59.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
Merchant_Conflict_59.text: Shhh, sweetheart - adults are talking. This is Guild business and we'll handle it - as soon as we get paid.
Merchant_Conflict_59.context: NodeContext: Patronising - but firm on the final words follow the - (she's showing Arfur she means business)

Merchant_Conflict_169.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_169.text: Enough of this bickering! You - what's your proposal?
Merchant_Conflict_169.context: InternalNodeContext: To the playerNodeContext: Snapping; wants to know what's what

Merchant_Conflict_31.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_31.text: Have you tried talking it out with them? Perhaps you could come to some sort of agreement.

Merchant_Conflict_230.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_230.text: Agreement? Why should I negotiate with the vermin who've stolen my house?!

Merchant_Conflict_7.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_7.text: I've got nothing to say to them.

Merchant_Conflict_112.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_112.text: I'll get them out of your house for free.

Merchant_Conflict_223.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_223.text: Old family motto: never trust anyone who works for free. What's in it for you?
Merchant_Conflict_223.context: NodeContext: Suspicious of the player's intentions (but proud of the motto)

Merchant_Conflict_29.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_29.text: I really just quite enjoy brutalising the poor.

Merchant_Conflict_108.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_108.text: I never said anyone needed to get hurt - as long as they get out as soon as possible.

Merchant_Conflict_126.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_126.text: But other than that, I don't care what methods you use. As long as you get rid of them - and fast - it's fine by me.
Merchant_Conflict_126.context: NodeContext: Frustrated; just wants to get this done

Merchant_Conflict_187.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_187.text: You're the rightful owner and they're trespassing. I want to see justice done.

Merchant_Conflict_81.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_81.text: A vigilante, eh? But you definitely have your head screwed on straight - a rarity these days.

Merchant_Conflict_69.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_69.text: Get those criminals out of my house and you'll have my profound gratitude.

Merchant_Conflict_197.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_197.text: Handling this myself is the only way I can guarantee there won't be any blood spilled.

Merchant_Conflict_159.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_159.text: My reasons are my own. Do you want to save some money or not?

Merchant_Conflict_41.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_41.text: Think you can do it? Fine. Be my guest.

Merchant_Conflict_157.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_157.text: Let them stay or I'll make you leave and never come back.

Merchant_Conflict_77.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_77.text: Fine, fine - they can stay. Just don't blame me when they turn on you like the mongrels they are!
Merchant_Conflict_77.context: NodeContext: Panicked by the threat but still trying to stick to his story before fleeing

Merchant_Conflict_220.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_220.text: Zenovia - why are you just standing there? Do what I'm paying you for!

Merchant_Conflict_51.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
Merchant_Conflict_51.text: You paid us to protect you and your high-quality merchandise on the road - and we've since arrived at our destination.

Merchant_Conflict_193.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
Merchant_Conflict_193.text: As I said - anything else is extra.

Merchant_Conflict_18.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_18.text: Ugh, this is the last time I hire someone from the Guild.

Merchant_Conflict_206.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_206.text: Fine - here's the extra. Finish. The job.
Merchant_Conflict_206.context: CinematicNodeContext: Reaches behind back to retrieve coin purse from inventory.NodeContext: Exasperation

Merchant_Conflict_182.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_182.text: Now please show this meddler some of that famous Rivington hospitality.
Merchant_Conflict_182.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gives gold to ZenoviaInternalNodeContext: He's not actually paying here, it is assumed he will pay later, but he has the gold.NodeContext: Wry

Merchant_Conflict_13.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
Merchant_Conflict_13.text: Come on, boys - let's take out the trash.
Merchant_Conflict_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gives gold to ZenoviaInternalNodeContext: He's not actually paying here, it is assumed he will pay later, but he has the gold.NodeContext: A little too pleased it's come to violence

Merchant_Conflict_94.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_94.text: My gold - it's gone! Zenovia, how could you let this happen?!

Merchant_Conflict_25.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
Merchant_Conflict_25.text: We did our job, Arfur. Looks like your eyes were bigger than your purse.

Merchant_Conflict_161.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
Merchant_Conflict_161.text: Come on, boys - let's go home.
Merchant_Conflict_161.context: NodeContext: A little weary by this point

Merchant_Conflict_5.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_5.text: This was your fault, I know it! The guards will hear about this, make no mistake!
Merchant_Conflict_5.context: InternalNodeContext: To the playerNodeContext: Indignant fury

Merchant_Conflict_64.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_64.text: You'll pay for this, you meddling reject!
Merchant_Conflict_64.context: InternalNodeContext: To the playerNodeContext: Indignant fury

Merchant_Conflict_72.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_72.text: I can make these squatters disappear for half as much as this lot are asking.

Merchant_Conflict_210.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_210.text: You don't exactly look desperate for gold, but I can't help but admire such solid business acumen.

Merchant_Conflict_215.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_215.text: Very well - get the job done and you'll be paid and be in my good graces.

Merchant_Conflict_174.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_174.text: I respect your candour, but I really don't want to upset my good friend Zenovia - or her lovely Rats.

Merchant_Conflict_217.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_217.text: But if you happened to take things into your own hands first, well - I couldn't stop you.
Merchant_Conflict_217.context: NodeContext: Definitely saying this on the down low

Merchant_Conflict_141.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_141.text: If you can't share, I will tear this house down and reclaim the land for nature.

Merchant_Conflict_86.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_86.text: I can always ask the Flaming Fist to mediate - they love a wartime property requisition.

Merchant_Conflict_26.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_26.text: You want the Flaming Fist poking around my business - my property? Gods...
Merchant_Conflict_26.context: NodeContext: self correcting "my business" to "my home"

Merchant_Conflict_221.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_221.text: Look, I know the Guild's rates - I'll solve your problem for half the cost.

Merchant_Conflict_219.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_219.text: I could just burn down the entire place. Then no one gets the house.

Merchant_Conflict_68.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_68.text: They stay, or I will burn this building until there is not a board left standing.

Merchant_Conflict_224.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_224.text: Well, I tried. I have more important things to take care of than squatting squabbles.

Merchant_Conflict_150.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
Merchant_Conflict_150.text: I guess we're all you've got, then, Arfur. Want your house squeaky clean? Cough up.
Merchant_Conflict_150.context: NodeContext: Mild amusement; knows she's right

Merchant_Conflict_3.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_3.text: Actually, it looks like your caravan crew are eager to help out - I think I'll leave it to them.

Merchant_Conflict_198.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_198.text: Fine - but you make them leave. No thugs. No coward shit. OR ELSE.

Merchant_Conflict_21.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_21.text: You want... me... to... um, hah. Buggery.
Merchant_Conflict_21.context: NodeContext: nervous, being forced into a difficult, compromising position by a terrfiying barbarian

Merchant_Conflict_47.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_47.text: Let them stay, a nearby church may give you coin for the trouble. Charity can pay.

Merchant_Conflict_97.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_97.text: The clergy? Poking around my business - my home?
Merchant_Conflict_97.context: NodeContext: self correcting "my business" to "my home"

Merchant_Conflict_125.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_125.text: No, no - it's fine. I'd rather these mongrels stay, if that's the choice.
Merchant_Conflict_125.context: NodeContext: nervous but resolved, this is the least bad option

Merchant_Conflict_101.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_101.text: Oh gods no. No, no, no. I won't be having the clergy poking their noses around my home.

Merchant_Conflict_139.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_139.text: It's always heartening to see a true philanthropist out in the wild.

Merchant_Conflict_186.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_186.text: Excuse me? I'm exceedingly charitable - ask anyone in this wretched town!

Merchant_Conflict_23.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_23.text: It's one thing to donate - extremely generously - to those less fortunate than oneself, and quite another to give away one's entire house!

Merchant_Conflict_131.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_131.text: Squatters, is it? Maybe I'd be willing to lend a helping hand.

Merchant_Conflict_85.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_85.text: Delve into this frustrated man's mind.

Merchant_Conflict_54.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_54.text: I can't let them stay here - what if the little brat gets into the basement?

Merchant_Conflict_201.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_201.text: You! You cast some kind of fell magic on me!

Merchant_Conflict_149.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_149.text: Just a little magic trick - nothing malevolent about it, I assure you.

Merchant_Conflict_90.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_90.text: I'm merely a concerned bystander. That man standing in front of your house, however...

Merchant_Conflict_44.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_44.text: It's worse than I thought - witchcraft.

Merchant_Conflict_82.speaker: Ben Golewits
Merchant_Conflict_82.context: NodeContext: Confused/alarmed; he's no magic user

Merchant_Conflict_100.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_100.text: Zenovia, get this evil creature and his coven out of my house before he tries to curse me again!
Merchant_Conflict_100.context: NodeContext: Still outraged but pretty pleased with himself for having protection

Merchant_Conflict_226.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
Merchant_Conflict_226.text: You didn't hire us to piss about with spellcasters - that'll definitely cost you double.

Merchant_Conflict_135.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_135.text: Do you think me a fool? Zenovia, that was an attempted assault on my person - time to do what I paid you for.
Merchant_Conflict_135.context: NodeContext: Still outraged but pretty pleased with himself for having protection

Merchant_Conflict_33.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
Merchant_Conflict_33.text: I suppose you're right. Come on, boys - let's beat that magic out of 'em.

Merchant_Conflict_138.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_138.text: I hear these sorts of houses always have basements - what do you use yours for?

Merchant_Conflict_227.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_227.text: My basement? Oh, nothing interesting! Just materials - I'm a craftsman, you see.
Merchant_Conflict_227.context: NodeContext: Nervous; definitely doesn't want the player to look in his basement so is trying to brush it off

Merchant_Conflict_195.speaker: Narrator
Merchant_Conflict_195.text: *This man is definitely lying - and he's really hoping you don't pry any further.*

Merchant_Conflict_148.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_148.text: Look, I have some very valuable components in there - I need to get that lot out before they damage something.
Merchant_Conflict_148.context: NodeContext: Anxious/insistent that he needs the refugees to leave

Merchant_Conflict_16.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_16.text: Mind if I take a look?

Merchant_Conflict_15.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_15.text: Who do you think you are? Zenovia, people are lining up to break into my property - do something about it!
Merchant_Conflict_15.context: NodeContext: Incredulous/indignant (and anxious in case they discover the secret stuff in his basement)

Merchant_Conflict_93.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_93.text: I could help you out with that if you want.

Merchant_Conflict_38.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_38.text: You left, they took it - it's not yours. Unless you kill them in single combat, of course.

Merchant_Conflict_116.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_116.text: If it comes down to such barbaric measures... Well, that's what I hired Zenovia here for.

Merchant_Conflict_58.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_58.text: Relax. You don't need all this space, these people do. Everyone wins.

Merchant_Conflict_167.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_167.text: None of this would have happened if you had a butler manning the house.

Merchant_Conflict_192.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_192.text: Everyone calm. Explain your disagreement, and we shall find an accord.

Merchant_Conflict_233.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_233.text: I don't see why I should be explaining myself. It's my property. They are on it - unlawfully.

Merchant_Conflict_200.speaker: Ben Golewits
Merchant_Conflict_200.text: Look, we needed somewhere to live. This place was empty, and it had walls. I've got children, for Tyr's sake.

Merchant_Conflict_121.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_121.text: Raise an eyebrow at Ben, is that all he has?

Merchant_Conflict_42.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_42.text: Gesture at Gregorio - invite him to reply.

Merchant_Conflict_191.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_191.text: Well, I'm... That's all very sad, b-but I still don't see how -

Merchant_Conflict_62.speaker: Ben Golewits
Merchant_Conflict_62.text: It gets cold out there at night, Mister Gregorio, my kids will get sick. Please, we'll stay out of your way, we just need a roof.

Merchant_Conflict_17.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_17.text: Look, time is money - and I'm losing both just standing here. Make your call, judge, before Zenovia makes it for you.

Merchant_Conflict_173.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_173.text: The refugees must go. I'll remove them, if you so desire.

Merchant_Conflict_79.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_79.text: They stay - and I will smite you down should you try and remove them.

Merchant_Conflict_152.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_152.text: I cannot make the call. Decide amongst yourselves.

Merchant_Conflict_188.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_188.text: The house seems big enough to share. Should be quite simple.

Merchant_Conflict_211.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_211.text: Mister Gregorio's right - your presence here is unlawful. It's his choice if you stay.

Merchant_Conflict_234.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_234.text: You certainly know how to make people feel welcome.

Merchant_Conflict_105.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_105.text: You shouldn't have to make people feel welcome in places they don't belong.
Merchant_Conflict_105.context: NodeContext: Pointed (aimed at the refugees but maybe a little at the player too)

Merchant_Conflict_204.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_204.text: Does no one we meet ever get along?

Merchant_Conflict_176.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_176.text: Not if they're trying to help themselves to other people's property!

Merchant_Conflict_73.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_73.text: This is quite a pitiful estate to be fighting over.

Merchant_Conflict_205.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_205.text: This is my home! I may pride myself on my philanthropy, but I draw the line at being a halfway house.
Merchant_Conflict_205.context: NodeContext: Frustrated/a little panicky; he is low on resources and this house is key

Merchant_Conflict_137.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
Merchant_Conflict_137.text: Zenovia and I are just navigating a slight contractual disagreement - not that it's any of your concern.
Merchant_Conflict_137.context: InternalNodeContext: To the playerNodeContext: Trying to hold it together through growing anger/frustration

Merchant_Conflict_37.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_37.text: You're right, it's not - I'll leave you to it.

Merchant_Conflict_165.speaker: Player
Merchant_Conflict_165.text: The army of the Absolute is mere days away and you're bickering over property ownership?

RefugeeLeader_31.speaker: Ben Golewits
RefugeeLeader_31.text: You did your good deed, but Torm's still watching you - don't disappoint him now.

RefugeeLeader_46.speaker: Ben Golewits
RefugeeLeader_46.text: The poncy prat who owns this place is long gone - so I think we can both agree he doesn't need it anymore.
RefugeeLeader_46.context: NodeContext: A little bit pleased about it

RefugeeLeader_47.speaker: Ben Golewits
RefugeeLeader_47.text: Not quite sure why you stood up for us like that, but I won't say I'm not grateful. Thanks. And may Torm keep you.
RefugeeLeader_47.context: NodeContext: A little confused but grateful

RefugeeLeader_62.speaker: Player
RefugeeLeader_62.text: One thing: stay out of the basement. It's not safe.

RefugeeLeader_37.speaker: Ben Golewits
RefugeeLeader_37.text: We're much more interested in the beds and the pantry - but I'll make sure Cinta knows the basement's off-limits.
RefugeeLeader_37.context: NodeContext: A little worried - but glad for the warning

RefugeeLeader_49.speaker: Ben Golewits
RefugeeLeader_49.text: Who are you? Some thug here to do that stuffed shirt's dirty work?
RefugeeLeader_49.context: NodeContext: Wary; unsure of the player's intentions

RefugeeLeader_67.speaker: Player
RefugeeLeader_67.text: What exactly is going on here?

RefugeeLeader_41.speaker: Player
RefugeeLeader_41.text: I'm trying to help you - wait here.

RefugeeLeader_86.speaker: Player
RefugeeLeader_86.text: The owner won't mind if you stay - you have my word.

RefugeeLeader_25.speaker: Ben Golewits
RefugeeLeader_25.text: Your word? Well... if you're sure. And you're definitely not pulling my leg...

RefugeeLeader_39.speaker: Ben Golewits
RefugeeLeader_39.text: I don't know if it's your place to give us permission to stay here, but thank you. Really. My family needs this.

RefugeeLeader_59.speaker: Player
RefugeeLeader_59.text: Here - take this. You'll be much better off in an inn than waiting to get chased out of here. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

RefugeeLeader_38.speaker: Ben Golewits
RefugeeLeader_38.text: I don't want to take charity from some stranger. But... I will. For the sake of my daughter.
RefugeeLeader_38.context: NodeContext: Clearly conflicted about the charity

RefugeeLeader_15.speaker: Ben Golewits
RefugeeLeader_15.context: NodeContext: With some difficulty due to being conflicted about accepting charity

RefugeeLeader_6.speaker: Player
RefugeeLeader_6.text: You should leave - there'll be trouble if you stay.

RefugeeLeader_21.speaker: Ben Golewits
RefugeeLeader_21.text: I spend most of my life hunting things that'd kill you as soon as they looked at you and you're telling me about 'trouble'?!

RefugeeLeader_36.speaker: Ben Golewits
RefugeeLeader_36.text: But... you're right. I can't risk those people getting a hold of my daughter.
RefugeeLeader_36.context: NodeContext: Calming himself for the sake of his family; resignation and a tinge of sadness when speaking about the kids

RefugeeLeader_83.speaker: Ben Golewits
RefugeeLeader_83.text: We'll get going as soon as we've got our things together.

RefugeeLeader_85.speaker: Ben Golewits
RefugeeLeader_85.text: Thanks for your concern, but it'll be safer for my family to have four walls and a roof over their heads.

RefugeeLeader_20.speaker: Ben Golewits
RefugeeLeader_20.context: NodeContext: Contemplative; he clearly anticipates an attack

RefugeeLeader_2.speaker: Player
RefugeeLeader_2.text: This is private property. You need to leave - or I'll make you.

RefugeeLeader_60.speaker: Ben Golewits
RefugeeLeader_60.text: You're seriously gonna throw us out? Throw my child out?
RefugeeLeader_60.context: NodeContext: Disbelief at the player's callousness

RefugeeLeader_55.speaker: Ben Golewits
RefugeeLeader_55.text: You're just as bad as the rest of them.

RefugeeLeader_76.speaker: Ben Golewits
RefugeeLeader_76.text: Don't worry - we'll go. May Torm split open that hard, blackened heart of yours some day.

RefugeeLeader_45.speaker: Ben Golewits
RefugeeLeader_45.text: You city thugs are all the same. I'll protect my family with my life if I have to!
RefugeeLeader_45.context: NodeContext: Desperate bravery; will do anything to protect his family

RefugeeLeader_50.speaker: Ben Golewits
RefugeeLeader_50.text: What's the word? Can we stay?

RefugeeLeader_63.speaker: Ben Golewits
RefugeeLeader_63.text: Back again, are you? What do you want with us now?
RefugeeLeader_63.context: NodeContext: Slightly wary (not sure of the player's intentions)

RefugeeLeader_77.speaker: Ben Golewits
RefugeeLeader_77.text: I don't like being cooped up inside, but it's what's best for Cinta - I'll make sure she knows you had a hand in it.

RefugeeLeader_80.speaker: Ben Golewits
RefugeeLeader_80.text: I see those animals are out of the picture - can we stay now, or are you going to turn on us next?

RefugeeLeader_65.speaker: Player
RefugeeLeader_65.text: Stay? What are you talking about?

RefugeeLeader_22.speaker: Ben Golewits
RefugeeLeader_22.text: The selfish ponce who owns this place was trying to hire some gang to throw us out - but it looks like you got rid of them.

RefugeeLeader_3.speaker: Player
RefugeeLeader_3.text: There's no one here to throw you out - I don't see why you can't stay.

RefugeeLeader_32.speaker: Ben Golewits
RefugeeLeader_32.text: We will stay. For now. I just hope he doesn't pay anyone else to come sniffing round.
RefugeeLeader_32.context: NodeContext: Grateful - but also a little concerned

RefugeeLeader_17.speaker: Ben Golewits
RefugeeLeader_17.text: Thank you - and may Torm keep you.

RefugeeLeader_23.speaker: Ben Golewits
RefugeeLeader_23.text: You're the first person in this city to have our backs. Thank you. Really.

RefugeeLeader_8.speaker: Player
RefugeeLeader_8.text: And you'd better be grateful for it.

RefugeeLeader_51.speaker: Ben Golewits
RefugeeLeader_51.text: I am. It's been days since my family slept under a roof - so thank you.

RefugeeLeader_71.speaker: Ben Golewits
RefugeeLeader_71.text: Oh. Well. Thank you. I think?
RefugeeLeader_71.context: NodeContext: Somewhat confused; wasn't expecting to be told they could stay

RefugeeLeader_64.speaker: Player
RefugeeLeader_64.text: How did you end up here?

RefugeeLeader_52.speaker: Ben Golewits
RefugeeLeader_52.text: Same way lots of us did - trying to get away from the army of the Absolute.

RefugeeLeader_69.speaker: Ben Golewits
RefugeeLeader_69.text: If you had the chance to put a roof over your family's heads after being on the run for Torm knows how long, wouldn't you?
RefugeeLeader_69.context: NodeContext: Matter of fact; expects the player to see where he's coming from

RefugeeLeader_74.speaker: Player
RefugeeLeader_74.text: No one's telling you to leave - have all the roof you want.

RefugeeLeader_68.speaker: Player
RefugeeLeader_68.text: I understand. Let me talk to the owner of this place - maybe I can help.

RefugeeLeader_75.speaker: Player
RefugeeLeader_75.text: I'm not interested in sob stories.

RefugeeLeader_33.speaker: Player
RefugeeLeader_33.text: Look, this place doesn't belong to you - get out or I'll have to throw you out.

RefugeeLeader_35.speaker: Player
RefugeeLeader_35.text: I'm trying to help you - I just need to talk to the man in charge.

RefugeeLeader_26.speaker: Ben Golewits
RefugeeLeader_26.text: Make it quick if you can - I don't like the way he's looking at us.
RefugeeLeader_26.context: NodeContext: Still a little wary (but matter of fact)

RefugeeLeader_5.speaker: Ben Golewits
RefugeeLeader_5.text: Off with you, then! We don't need an audience, that's for sure.

RefugeeLeader_84.speaker: Ben Golewits
RefugeeLeader_84.text: I heard you talking about us - you gonna kick my little girl out onto the streets, are you?
RefugeeLeader_84.context: NodeContext: Angry; worried about his family and defensive of them

AD_Conflict_1.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
AD_Conflict_1.text: Look, I really need you all to leave right this instant.
AD_Conflict_1.context: NodeContext: Getting increasingly angry (and a little panicky)

AD_Conflict_4.speaker: Ben Golewits
AD_Conflict_4.text: We've got nowhere else to go, you heartless sod!

AD_Conflict_5.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
AD_Conflict_5.text: That's not my problem, now, is it?

AD_Conflict_2.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
AD_Conflict_2.text: If you don't get out of there, I'm... I'm going to have to make you.

AD_Conflict_3.speaker: Ben Golewits
AD_Conflict_3.text: Oh yeah? Gonna get your thugs to butcher my wife and kid, are you?

AD_Conflict_8.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
AD_Conflict_8.text: That's not what I meant! But if you do insist on continuing to be difficult...
AD_Conflict_8.context: NodeContext: Indignant (although mild, contemplatively threatening edge on second sentence)

AD_Conflict_6.speaker: Ben Golewits
AD_Conflict_6.context: NodeContext: Defensive of his family inside the house

AD_Conflict_7.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
AD_Conflict_7.text: Stay back? You're in my house!

ThugLeader_Confrontation_8.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_Confrontation_8.text: Do you think you're clever coming in and undercutting us, sweetheart?

ThugLeader_Confrontation_26.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_Confrontation_26.text: We were about to make a bit of extra cash before you butted in - you owe the Guild a cut.

ThugLeader_Confrontation_68.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
ThugLeader_Confrontation_68.text: Is the little dog trying to intimidate us? If it continues to bark, I will snap its neck.

ThugLeader_Confrontation_94.speaker: Narrator
ThugLeader_Confrontation_94.text: *The Guild: a loose coalition uniting every criminal outfit in the city under one collective rule, from cutpurses to contract killers.*

ThugLeader_Confrontation_31.speaker: Player
ThugLeader_Confrontation_31.text: I had a look in your employer's basement - did you know he puts explosives in children's toys?

ThugLeader_Confrontation_63.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_Confrontation_63.text: And I'm the Duke's personal bed warmer. I don't care what pies he's got his grimy little fingers in - just give me the gold.
ThugLeader_Confrontation_63.context: NodeContext: Sarcastic/starting to lose her patience ever so slightly

ThugLeader_Confrontation_149.speaker: Player
ThugLeader_Confrontation_149.text: How much gold are we talking?

ThugLeader_Confrontation_121.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_Confrontation_121.text: Just a little something - consider it a gesture of good will. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
ThugLeader_Confrontation_121.context: NodeContext: Almost warm - maybe the player is going to appease her

ThugLeader_Confrontation_14.speaker: Player
ThugLeader_Confrontation_14.text: I'll pay you, but I need some time to get the gold together.

ThugLeader_Confrontation_87.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_Confrontation_87.text: You think I'm just a pretty face? You'll pay up now - and just for trying it on, you can pay me double.
ThugLeader_Confrontation_87.context: NodeContext: Slightly playful - but most definitely a threat

ThugLeader_Confrontation_24.speaker: Player
ThugLeader_Confrontation_24.text: I'm not paying you that much - that's pure extortion.

ThugLeader_Confrontation_61.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_Confrontation_61.text: You know, it's shocking how many people opt for the hard way when the easy way's right there. Any last words?
ThugLeader_Confrontation_61.context: NodeContext: Weary; was hoping this would be easier

ThugLeader_Confrontation_18.speaker: Player
ThugLeader_Confrontation_18.text: Do you think I was born yesterday? That's nowhere near Guild rates - half it and we'll call it a deal.

ThugLeader_Confrontation_69.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_Confrontation_69.text: Sharp little creature, aren't you? All right then - half.

ThugLeader_Confrontation_6.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_Confrontation_6.context: NodeContext: Patronising - like telling a dog it's been good

ThugLeader_Confrontation_80.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_Confrontation_80.text: Well, boys - we did what we were paid for. Let's leave this lot to their misery.
ThugLeader_Confrontation_80.context: NodeContext: Almost sighing; it's been a long day

ThugLeader_Confrontation_15.speaker: Player
ThugLeader_Confrontation_15.text: Works for me. And, as we're all friends now, maybe I could get some Guild assistance of my own at some point?

ThugLeader_Confrontation_79.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_Confrontation_79.text: Smooth talker, aren't you? What did you have in mind?

ThugLeader_Confrontation_4.speaker: Player
ThugLeader_Confrontation_4.text: Can you get me into the city proper?

ThugLeader_Confrontation_78.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_Confrontation_78.text: Not my personal area of expertise - but Nine-Fingers'll know how.

ThugLeader_Confrontation_131.speaker: Player
ThugLeader_Confrontation_131.text: I could do with a blade like yours - you ready for your next job?

ThugLeader_Confrontation_30.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_Confrontation_30.text: How presumptuous - it's almost endearin'. That'd be up to Nine-Fingers to decide.

ThugLeader_Confrontation_56.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_Confrontation_56.text: She's at the Guildhall in the Lower City - you can't miss her.

ThugLeader_Confrontation_145.speaker: Player
ThugLeader_Confrontation_145.text: I want to meet your boss.

ThugLeader_Confrontation_51.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_Confrontation_51.context: NodeContext: Amused and almost a little impressed at the audacity of the request

ThugLeader_Confrontation_67.speaker: Player
ThugLeader_Confrontation_67.text: Nothing for now - I just wanted to make sure it was an option.

ThugLeader_Confrontation_62.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_Confrontation_62.text: It certainly could be - I'll be sure to let Nine-Fingers know you're interested in collaboratin'.
ThugLeader_Confrontation_62.context: NodeContext: Mildly amused at the proposition

ThugLeader_Confrontation_11.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_Confrontation_11.text: Sweet of you to ask, but I don't think you can afford me.

ThugLeader_Confrontation_111.speaker: Player
ThugLeader_Confrontation_111.text: Actually I've changed my mind - no deal.

ThugLeader_Confrontation_84.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_Confrontation_84.text: You know, this was fun to begin with but now I'm getting bored.

ThugLeader_Confrontation_113.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_Confrontation_113.text: Boys - how about a bit of the Rivington Rats' famous hospitality for our friend here?

ThugLeader_Confrontation_55.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_Confrontation_55.text: As far as you're concerned, I am the Guild. And you know what? The price has just doubled. What a shame.

ThugLeader_Confrontation_148.speaker: Player
ThugLeader_Confrontation_148.text: Knock some sense into this upstart.

ThugLeader_Confrontation_46.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player swings at Zenovia and punches her (punch can be cut around to avoid showing actual contact)

ThugLeader_Confrontation_9.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_Confrontation_9.text: That... was a mistake on your part, sweetie. A mistake the Guild will hear about.

ThugLeader_Confrontation_29.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_Confrontation_29.text: Come on, boys - we've got places to be.
ThugLeader_Confrontation_29.context: InternalNodeContext: To the Rivington RatsNodeContext: Stiffly; trying to save face

ThugLeader_Confrontation_86.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player swings at Zenovia - who dodges out of the way and punches the player in return (punch can be cut around to avoid showing actual contact)

ThugLeader_Confrontation_83.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_Confrontation_83.text: You're a clumsy little kitten, aren't you? Adorable.

ThugLeader_Confrontation_58.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_Confrontation_58.text: I'll almost feel sorry grinding you into the dirt.
ThugLeader_Confrontation_58.context: NodeContext: Amused; she definitely does not feel sorry for the player

ThugLeader_Confrontation_3.speaker: Player
ThugLeader_Confrontation_3.text: I'm not giving you a single gold piece.

ThugLeader_Confrontation_38.speaker: Player
ThugLeader_Confrontation_38.text: Whatever you've been paid isn't worth dying to me - I know how to make it hurt.

ThugLeader_Confrontation_71.speaker: Player
ThugLeader_Confrontation_71.text: I've always been a difficult person - I just can't help it.

ThugLeader_Confrontation_98.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_Confrontation_98.text: You know, somehow I can believe that.
ThugLeader_Confrontation_98.context: NodeContext: Mild amusement - but she's still going to kill the player anyway

ThugLeader_Confrontation_104.speaker: Player
ThugLeader_Confrontation_104.text: Then you're as much of a monster as he is.

ThugLeader_Confrontation_21.speaker: Player
ThugLeader_Confrontation_21.text: You can deal with those refugees yourself if you really want - I'm not invested.

ThugLeader_Confrontation_2.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_Confrontation_2.text: Ah, but thanks to your little interference with our business, you are invested.

ThugLeader_Confrontation_41.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_Confrontation_41.text: And we can't have our mutual friend Arfur thinking he outsmarted us.
ThugLeader_Confrontation_41.context: NodeContext: Almost laughing through her quiet anger

ThugLeader_Confrontation_23.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_Confrontation_23.text: Give me what you owe or maybe I'll just have to help myself to it when you're dead.

ThugLeader_Confrontation_49.speaker: Player
ThugLeader_Confrontation_49.text: Suppose I agree - what is this cut exactly?

ThugLeader_Confrontation_16.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_Confrontation_16.text: I see you're a charitable sort - perhaps you have some benevolence to spare for us poor souls?

ThugLeader_Confrontation_146.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_Confrontation_146.text: We just lost a load of gold thanks to somebody interfering in our business, you see, and now we're a little out of pocket.
ThugLeader_Confrontation_146.context: NodeContext: Mock ignorance - and clearly slightly annoyed

ThugLeader_Confrontation_28.speaker: Player
ThugLeader_Confrontation_28.text: Real shame, that - but you'll have to find your charitable donation elsewhere.

ThugLeader_Confrontation_54.speaker: Player
ThugLeader_Confrontation_54.text: I fought and killed an avatar of Myrkul recently. Do you have any last words?

ThugLeader_Confrontation_100.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_Confrontation_100.text: You're... serious. Let's forget this unpleasantness ever happened.

ThugLeader_Confrontation_96.speaker: Player
ThugLeader_Confrontation_96.text: I am the child of Lord Bhaal, this filthy city's eternal terror. Do you have any last words?

ThugLeader_Confrontation_130.speaker: Player
ThugLeader_Confrontation_130.text: Calm down - how much are you after exactly?

ThugLeader_Confrontation_140.speaker: Player
ThugLeader_Confrontation_140.text: I could give you that gold - but then I'd just take it back after I killed you.

ThugLeader_Confrontation_126.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_Confrontation_126.text: I think you're overestimating your abilities somewhat - but I haven't got time for this.
ThugLeader_Confrontation_126.context: NodeContext: Trying to save face after successfully being intimidated; trying to pretend she's just too busy to deal with this and not afraid at the bloody threat

ThugLeader_Confrontation_135.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_Confrontation_135.text: You took the words right out of my mouth.
ThugLeader_Confrontation_135.context: NodeContext: Relishing the imminent fight; she's glad to be able to kill the player (or try)

ThugLeader_Confrontation_102.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_Confrontation_102.text: You think you can just waltz in here and meddle with our livelihood?

ThugLeader_Confrontation_138.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_Confrontation_138.text: I respect your hustle, sweetheart, but it won't work on me.

ThugLeader_Confrontation_36.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_Confrontation_36.text: You've stepped on the Guild's toes - and we'd like a little something to make it better.

ThugLeader_Confrontation_25.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
ThugLeader_Confrontation_25.text: I'd say 'you'll live to regret it' but honestly I'm not so sure you'd live.
ThugLeader_Confrontation_25.context: NodeContext: Clearly confident in her ability to kill the player

ThugLeader_Confrontation_45.speaker: Player
ThugLeader_Confrontation_45.text: I am the child of Lord Bhaal, this filthy city's eternal terror. Do you have any last words?

ThugLeader_Confrontation_44.speaker: Player
ThugLeader_Confrontation_44.text: I fought and killed an avatar of Myrkul recently. I think I can handle you.

ThugLeader_Confrontation_97.speaker: Player
ThugLeader_Confrontation_97.text: All right, I get it - how much do you want?

RefugeeDaughter_1.speaker: Cinta Golewits
RefugeeDaughter_1.text: I bet I could hit that fancy one right on the nose... POW!

RefugeeDaughter_2.speaker: Cinta Golewits
RefugeeDaughter_2.text: Now we don't have to leave, I'm going to build a big house for all the rats! It's gonna be really fancy - you'll see!

RefugeeDaughter_3.speaker: Cinta Golewits
RefugeeDaughter_3.text: Mama made me a bow for my birthday - do you think it'll scare those mean people away? I do.

RefugeeDaughter_4.speaker: Cinta Golewits
RefugeeDaughter_4.text: Oh, and I'm supposed to say thank you for helping us... so thank you!
RefugeeDaughter_4.context: NodeContext: She forgot (but is genuinely grateful)

AD_RefugeeLeader_ChasedOut_0.speaker: Ben Golewits
AD_RefugeeLeader_ChasedOut_0.text: No - no no no! Don't you dare lay a finger on them!
